data.Extracurricular: National Honor Society, Peer Mediation, Student Government, Student Leadership Retreats, Science Fair and Science Research Program, Math and Technology Fair, Student Internships, Advanced Visual Arts Classes, and Saturday Academy. Performing Arts: one of the biggest and best in NYC offering 3 full concert bands, 2 jazz bands, 2 choral ensembles, 2 dance ensembles, chamber groups such as guitar ensemble, brass choir or clarinet choir, and AP Music Theory. No previous music experience is necessary to join the performing arts. Our program allows students to perform at their ability level regardless of age or experience. Beginning players perform in the Concert Band, intermediate players perform in the Symphonic Band and advanced players perform in the Wind Ensemble. The choral and dance programs offer similar options to the students. All musical ensembles compete annually at the New York State Music Association festival where they have received multiple "Gold" and "Gold with Distinction" awards. Annual theater/musical theater performances by students. We also offer over 20 after-school clubs, Presentations at City/State Conferences, and School Spirit Activities.

We have had students travel through some programs to Greece, Brazil and other countries around the world; our students have spoken before the Senate through our partnerships and traveled to Los Angeles, Washington D.C. and Albany to meet with politicians to discuss social justice issues; and we have communicated and supported schools and families in the Sudan and sub-Saharan Africa through other clubs and organizations. data.Extracurricular: Law Enforcement Academy, Computer Forensic, Art, Big Siblings Program, Cheerleading, Chess, Community Service Opportunities, Dance, Debate Team, Drama, Explorers, Leadership Classes, Math Club, Model United Nations, Moot Court/Mock Trial, Multicultural, Peer Mediators, Youth Court, Extended Learning Academy, College Now, and Virtual Learning. The performing arts department at the Grand Street Campus where School for Legal Studies is located is one of the biggest and best in NYC. We have three full concert bands, two jazz bands, two choral ensembles, and numerous chamber groups such as guitar ensemble, brass choir or clarinet choir. Students also have the option of taking A.P. Music Theory. While it is very useful, no previous experience is necessary to join the performing arts department. The instrumental and choral programs draw from all three schools in the campus and allow students to perform at their ability level regardless of age or experience. All musical ensembles compete annually at the New York State Music Association festival where they have received multiple "Gold" and "Gold with Distinction" awards.
